content.description: Stand start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand two-finger pocket. From there, climb straight up compressing the arete and vertical seam with the left hand to reach the lip and an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there is a tree behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the north section of Iggy's east face.

content.description:
The problem climbs the "H" feature at the center of Iggy's east face.

Stand start with a pair of sidepulls roughly five feet off the deck. From there, work straight up a pair of vertical incut rails to reach a solid topout.

The initial feet are tricky, but once you get them to the horizontal edge at the seven foot mark, you're home free.
content.protection: A pad should do it, the immediate landing is very good, but there is a young tree behind the problem.
content.location: This ascends the east face of Iggy Rock.

content.description: Stand start with a great right hand sidepull and a left hand palming the face. From there, work straight up through a finger-lock to reach a featured topout.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the southern portion of Iggy's east face.
